destroy_item_text: Are you sure you want to remove **%{title}?**
details_placeholder: you might want to give more details on the item or the transaction
username_tip: Username can be anything made of 1 to 20 letters, figures or _
persona_tip_intro: We use Mozilla's Persona service to identify users. Why?
persona_tip_1: 1/ Inventaire is very young and can't give you a 100% garanty that your password will be safe just yet.
persona_tip_2: 2/ as other services use this, that makes you less passwords to remember!
persona_tip_3: 3/ Mozilla don't ask for any of your data out of your email.
persona_tip_last: Last but not least, **you probably already have an account** depending on your email provider. Click the button to verify. Don't have an account yet? Click the button too and follow their instructions.
pitch_transition: This is an experiment about resources and capabilities. Given a resource you have or you look for, what are your possibilities? Make, give, get from a gift, lend, borrow, rent, buy, sell, upcycle, recycle... The goal of the Inventaire project is to **map those possibilities**, make alternatives visible. At the same time, this is about easing resources data transparency and openness, and the transmission of those data from the business to the customer.
pitch_just_books: That's already a wide program isn't it? **Let's start small: just mapping books in your network or nearby**, available for giving, lending or selling. Peer to peer first, but integrating local libraries and local booksellers in the map as soon as possible.
pitch_open_knowledge: **Information on resources should be free and open for citizens to be empowered in their daily choices**. What if our daily interactions with resources, our transactions, were contributing to make everyone's knowledge on those resources grow? **Inventaire is an experiment to make a step in this direction**, starting by using **[Wikidata](http://wikidata.org/)** - the awesome public database gathering facts for Wikipedia - as a starting point to gather data on resources. All public data gathered in Inventaire will be published under an open licence.
pitch_open_source: Closed centralized systems grow dependancy and lock-in the user in this system, while contributive, free and open knowledge needs trust to thrive. Trust comes from the possibilty always opened to take what was built together and continue somewhere else, to explore new avenues or if the choices made here start to diverge from what the community expects. That's why **[Inventaire's code](http://github.com/inventaire/inventaire/) is a Free/Open software published under the [AGPL3 licence](http://www.gnu.org/licenses/agpl-3.0.html)**. Today, the Inventaire experiment has a centralized technical architecture as decentralized architectures are hard to achieve: efforts are focused on bringing users value from open knowledge with as little pain as possible, but finding ways to overcome this centralization is part of the trip.
pitch_your_data: For advanced users, you can already download your inventory data at any time: download it as a raw JSON file or make a backup to a database you control (using [PouchDB](http://pouchdb.com/) replication). In the future, data should be interoperable and synchronizable with Personal Data Stores. In the current architecture, the user has to entrust Inventaire with all her data: those private data won't be shared with any third party
data_export_intro: The data schema is neither mature nor standardized yet: it is unlikely to be compatible out of the box with any other of your data sets. Still, if the NSA allows itself to have it, you should be allowed to have it too.
status_text: Everything has to start somewhere: expect missing features and bugs. Do not publish sensible data. At this point, the best use possible is in groups of friends wishing to share books and who can easily communicate with other tools: there is no internal messaging service yet, but there will be soon!
inventorize_it: just add it to my inventory
just_inventorize_it: none (just add it to my inventory)
missing_account_title: couldn't find an account associated with this email
missing_account_legend: it seems, you have a Persona account but not an Inventaire.io account, you might need to create one:
joyride_last: it's a very young tool yet, you will probably encounter missing features and bugs, but hopefully you now have a good hint of where this project is going. You may even want to contribute to make it grow: if so, that's great!! Your contribution is more than welcome for there is a lot of work! - At this point, the best is to use it with friends. Share it with your network and join the conversation!
joyride_last_conlusion_point_2: now let's inventorize all the things!
email_note: the email you use to identify with Mozilla Persona will be the one Inventaire uses to send you notifications
labs_intro: Inventaire is an experimentation to empower citizens with better information on resources, and the Labs is the place for pionners to try those new paths!
open_source_credits: standing on the shoulders of [libre and open source giants](https://github.com/inventaire/inventaire#powered-by)!
pictures_credits: wonderful Creative Commons pictures by [Sarah Buckley](https://www.flickr.com/photos/17207222@N02/6117998074/), [artfullife](https://www.flickr.com/photos/artfullife/3589991695/) and [ginnerobot](https://www.flickr.com/photos/ginnerobot/3102623100). Thanks!
find_by_isbn_title: does your book have an ISBN? (the identifier near the barcode)
username_change_confirmation:
Your current username is **%{currentUsername}**
Are you sure you want to change for **%{requestedUsername}**?
username_change_warning: You shouldn't change your username too often, as it's the way others can find you
waiting_for_persona: a popup should now open to let you verify your credentials
persona_tip_email: your contact email will be the one you use with Persona
persona_tip_password: you don't need to create a password if you use Persona
persona_popup_signup: After you login on Persona, you will receive an email from Person to validate inventaire.io. You then just need to click the link in this email
persona_email_return: Almost done! Now you just need to valid the new Persona authentification popup and you are all set!
email_confirmation_error: email confirmation request was invalid or expired
email_confirmation_offline_error: login to request a new confirmation email
new_confirmation_email:
a new confirmation email was sent:
now you just need to check your mailbox and click the link in the email
email_wasnt_verified:
**your email wasn't verified.**
If you can't find the verification email in your mailbox, you can request a new one by clicking the following button:
confirmation_password_reset_email_sent: An email was sent at this address to allow you to reset your password: check your mailbox!
request_new_token: request a new chance to reset your password
feedback_intro: A bug to report, a functionality that you absolutely need, or maybe you just want to send love? You can do that here!
get_involved: Think you can contribute to make Inventaire better? Get involved!!
contribution_ideas: Ask to be added to the [project development board](https://trello.com/b/0lKcsZDj/inventaire-roadmap), join the [translation team](https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/inventaire/), post an [issue on github](https://github.com/inventaire/inventaire/issues), or simply start a discussion from here or on social networks!
newletter_pitch:
Want to be updated of the project developments?
Subscribe to the newsletter! (low frequency)
item_request_text_suggestion_giving: Hello %{username}! May I have this book?
item_request_text_suggestion_lending: Hello %{username}! May I borrow this book?
item_request_text_suggestion_selling: Hello %{username}! May I buy this book?
comment_delete_confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this comment?
waiting_accepted: waiting for %{username} to accept the request
main_user_confirmed: you confirmed that you got the book
other_user_confirmed: %{username} confirmed to have received the book
confirm_reception: confirm that you received the book
waiting_return_confirmation: Now enjoy the book! Then return it as agreed with its owner
confirm_returned: confirm that the book was returned
main_user_returned: you confirmed that you recovered the book
other_user_returned: %{username} confirmed to have recovered the book
exchanges_manager_welcome_text:
This is where the books requests you send or receive will be displayed.
To send a book request, go to the book's page and click on "send a request"
add_menu_title: add a book to your inventory
add_by_search: search your book by its title, author or ISBN
add_by_isbn: add a book by its ISBN
scanner_disabled_tip: only available from mobiles for now
add_by_isbn_tip: enter one ISBN or several separeted by a comma
existing_instance_cant_add: you already have this book in your inventory, you can't add it again
read_more_on_wikipedia: Read more or edit on Wikipedia
decline_request_info_giving: the book will be added to your inventory
confirm_reception_info_selling: the book will be added to your inventory
unfriend_confirmation: do you really want to remove **%{username}** from your friends?
requires_barcode_scanner_app: To be able to scan your books barcode, you need to have a Barcode Scanner app already installed on your smartphone:
title_add_layout: add a book to your inventory
title_networt_layout: connect to your friends and communtities to see their books
title_browse_layout: browse the books in your friends and communities inventories
title_exchanges_layout: messages you sent or received about giving, lending or selling books
call_to_connect_welcome_message: the infinite inventory of your friends' and communities' books!
global_email_toggle_warning: Disabling all emails notification is discouraged as you might miss important notifications: if possible, use the sections here after to fine-tune your settings
friendship_request_notification: someone send your a friendship request
group_invite_notification: you have been invited to join a group
group_acceptRequest_notification: your request to join a group as been accepted
your_item_was_requested_notification: one of your books as been requested
update_on_your_item_notification: updates in an exchange about one of your books
update_on_item_you_requested_notificatio: updates in a exchange about a book you requested
inventories_activity_summary_notificatio: receive the summary of what happened in your network
activity_summary_periodicity_tip: number of **days** between activity summary emails
cookies_are_required: cookies are required for the authentification to work: please change your browsers' settings and retry
group_make_admin_confirmation: Are you sure you want to make **%{username}** admin of the group?
group_kick_confirmation: Are you sure you want to remove **%{username}** of the group?
group_make_admin_warning: This can't be undone and an admin can't be removed from a group, even by another admin
user_made_admin: **%{username}** named you admin of the group **%{groupName}**
group_update_description: **%{username}** changed the description of the group **%{groupName}**
leave_group_confirmation: Are you sure you want to **leave the group %{groupName}**?
leave_group_warning: this can be undone later by requesting to join the group again, but you will need an admin's approval
leave_button_disabled: being the unique group admin, you can't leave the group without naming another admin
destroy_group_confirmation: Are you sure you want to destroy the group **%{groupName}**?
position_privacy_context: Giving your position allows people nearby to see and request your public books.
position_privacy_tip: No need to give your exact address, just pick a position near where you live or work, or just where you feel confortable doing book exchanges.
user_default_description: see the books %{username} want to give, lend or sell
group_default_description: see the books members of the group %{groupName} want to give, lend or sell
delete_account_confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete your account "**%{username}**"?
delete_account_warning:
**There is no way back!!!**
In case you are at the moment under the effects of alcohol or something, don't touch anything anymore: unplug your computer, turn off your phone, turn it back on to call someone (nop, not your ex) that could put those under lock and give you back the key once you will have sober.
In other cases, go ahead. Just be aware that we might cry a little
donate_intro:
inventaire.io is a project aiming to produce useful tools to handle our resources while pushing open knowledge further. In the medium-term, the project's mission should be [supported by an economic activity as described in the Roadmap](https://trello.com/c/Z7alRtpZ).
Until then, you can **support the project development by donating** through one of the following channels:
non_monetary_donations:
The biggest and simplest contribution you can do is to **help us spread the news** about this project: [invite your friends to share their inventory](/network/users/invite), share the project throughout all the Internet, write a blog post or a tutorial about it... be creative!
But there are also [other ways to contribute](https://trello.com/c/VIkw1d8q)
refresh_wikidata_data: if you made modifications on Wikidata related to this entity, you can use this button to ask inventaire.io to fetch the updated data
group_position_context: If your group is associated to a specific place (a universities, a coworkings, etc.), it can be useful to indicate it's position to help other users to find it
article_limitation: this is an article and not book: it can't be added to your inventory
